Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: mmaatt
Reviews.Content: A 4-star hotel in a 5-star location, right in Gendarmenmarkt, very close to Stadtmitte U-Bahn station. Some of the most interesting museums, galleries, shops and restaurants are within a walking distance. There are two breakfast options- I recommend one in the panorama lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient city hotel”
Reviews.Author: ganahal
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent position in a very nice central area. Clean, comfortable, nice staff, good value for money. There's no in-house restaurant but for breakfast. The area is plenty of good restaurants within 2 minutes walk indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Csarrald
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the hotel. Service really nice. Very good breakfast, well located, wi fi in the room. Personnel of the hotel provided me with an adaptator for my computer.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel 8 years ago before its transformation into a boutique hotel. We booked again for March 2012 and stayed 3 nights. 8 years ago the hotel offered a fantastic location as it still does.. walking distance to just about everything in Mitte area. Many restaurants to choose from, easy access to u bahn and buses, a supermarket on Leipzigerstrasse around the corner, and a dry cleaners which we did not visit this time but found very useful 8 years ago. The superior room on the front facing the street ( Charlottenstrasse) was fine for the 2 of us. Noise at night was not an issue and the electric roll down shutters ensure privacy and quiet at night. The hotel is vey much in a modern, spare style and very very clean. Beds comfortable and linen of top quality. 3 types of pillows to choose from if you want. Staff helpful and most spoke perfect English. Internet only available in the lobby and you need help if you don't speak German to use the computer. Staff very helpful with this. I would rate the hotel higher except that it was the only one we stayed at on this trip ( out of 5 hotels in different cities ) where breakfast was not included unlike 8 years ago. But maybe this is the way it is now in Berlin at least in this kind of hotel. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, Safe, Clean”
Reviews.Author: felix78901
Reviews.Content: It's not the most exciting part of Mitte, but the location is safe and super convenient to public transportation. Rooms are well appointed and super clean (I had a square toilet in mine - a first!). Good toiletries. Excellent staff. i found the bed a bit hard for my liking, but that's often the case for me. I would recommend this for single business travelers or couples. Breakfast is expensive (as with all European hotels) but very good.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ananLAX
Reviews.Content: We (me and my wife) had a great stay at this hotel for 3 nights during christmas 2011 We took taxi from the airport and it cost about 20 Euros. This hotel is a small and very cute hotel. The entire ambiance from the lobby is very attractive. Location: Hotel is very conveniently location in center of mitte, you can walk to most of the attractions and if required stattmitte (U) station is just outside the station Staff: Best of Best.. Great service, were very helpful, friendly and smiling. During our stay 3 of staff were there, do not know the names, But amazing service. Rooms : Rooms were very clean and well arranged. Dont miss: The chocolate shop next door to the hotel. Try mark brandenburger restaurant just opp. to the hotel. We also had coffee, wine and few winter drink like Lumumba in the hotel lobby, it was good and reasonably priced. Overall, one of the best and cute hotel we have stayed. I think we will visit again to Berlin, atleast to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely view overlooking the square, area was a bit sterile though”
Reviews.Author: Mec224
Reviews.Content: When I stayed at the Hotel Gendarm, we had one of the newly renovated rooms overlooking a beautiful platz. The room itself was nicely decorated and clean and the beds were very comfortable. I was there with my mom and the room did feel a bit squished at times - like there were no places to put the suitcases so unless you definitely want to unpack your case, you'll be digging around your suitcases on the floor. The hotel is in a part of the mitte that, while centrally located, felt very sterile. I felt like I could be anywhere in the world, like New York or Boston, rather than in a foreign country. Thats not so much a fault of the hotel as its surrounds but it was something I wish I had known before I booked at the Gendarm. The staff tried to be very helpful although there were some missteps. For example, we asked them to confirm a dinner reservation for us. They told us the restaurant had lost the reservation and was completely booked but when we spoke to the restaurant they offered us a space at a communal table which we happily accepted. I'm not sure why the hotel did not convey the restaurants offer to us. To sum up: a cute hotel, which a charming view of the platz but in an otherwise sterile area.

Reviews.Title: “a place where to go and return”
Reviews.Author: Chalupin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed for second time (first time in june 2009) at the hotel "Gendarm nouveau" in Berlin. This is really a very fine place for several reasons. - People at the front desk are very nice, available and smiling. -The rooms, and specially the "superior" ones are very plesant, of really good size, with fine and very comfortable furniture, and a well fitted bath.... -The breakfast is delicious: beside the usual food: ham, cheese, yogurt bacon eggs etc.. there are everyday some new little original and different dishes (asiatic or oriental inspiration).... and the frish bread are very good. - The situation in Berlin is fantastic: central, very calm, in front of the two beautiful german an french cathedrals, very near (15 min walking) from all the great museums, three blocks from the opera, one block from commercial galleries.... A very good hotel, where we certainly will return everytime we will go to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie W
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel! It may not be the biggest hotel in Berlin, but could very easily be the best hotel in the city. The staff were very friendly and helpful, from check in at reception, to running into cleaning staff in the elevator to the restaurant staff...all outstanding. We stayed in one of the Junior Suites and were very happy with our accommodation. Lovely room with a stunning view. When you put this fabulous little hotel only steps away from the picturesque Gendarmenmarkt, you definitely can not go wrong. The hotel is also a very close walk to Checkpoint Charlie and you can also easily walk to Brandenburg Gate. There are numerous restaurants, bistros and lounges all right on your doorstep as well as great shopping. From now on, anytime we are in Berlin, this is the only hotel we will stay in. Highly, highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great service and top location!”
Reviews.Author: Jason W
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on location and TripAdvisor / their own website info. We were both so glad we did. The location is just brilliant - on the south west corner of the Gendarmenmarkt and right next door to Fassbender & Rauch chocolate shop (DO try this place, amazing!). We booked the Junior Suite and it was lovely. A very comfortable bed, rain shower, and plenty of little touches such as Fassbender chocolates every night, lots of little photo frames around the room, etc. Yes just little touches but it all adds up to make a great experience! The staff were very friendly and helpful and couldn't be faulted. Breakfast was plentiful and well presented. Nothing special but then it's breakfast! Fruit, cereal, eggs, bacon, etc. Everything was readily available. We would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in the Mitte and anyone not wanting to stay in a large "soulless" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful new small hotel in the heart of Berlin, great value for price”
Reviews.Author: wendeln97
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the Gendarmenmarkt in the centre of Berlin (Mitte). Great hotel, charming, nice people, good service, small and personal, good breakfast! Can simply recommend it for both business travel but also when you travel with family and want to see the cits. The value you get for the price is awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific place”
Reviews.Author: Polderpolder
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Gendarm Nouveau very much. The modern interior of the rooms, the jolly staff, the breakfast with newspapers, and the location of the hotel in the middel of 'Mitte' were all excellent. The reception is extremely helpful and very professional. With so much professionalism around the only small detail missing was a good restaurant guide. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Small, friendly, great location”
Reviews.Author: JimLoomis3
Reviews.Content: I originally picked the Hotel Gendarm because the price was right and it seemed to be centrally located. After a two-day stay, I’m happy to say it does indeed have both of those qualities, and a lot more. First, it’s a tidy place, just a dozen or so rooms, but neat as a pin and very comfortable. The rooms are spacious, well laid out and the beds very comfortable and with excellent lighting for reading, which is a major issue for me. The bathrooms are on the small side and the fixtures, clearly created by a talented contemporary designer, took me a few minutes (and a two-second, very cold shower) to figure out. But it’s very minor and probably a generational issue anyway. The staff is young, female, attractive – Wait, make that VERY attractive! – and they all speak excellent English, several with almost no trace of an accent. The complimentary breakfast is really excellent: fresh fruit and juices, cereals, breakfast meats, cheeses, a different preparation of eggs each morning, and a variety of excellent pastries. Bottom line: If you’re not into small, personal and very friendly instead of big, fancy and expensive, by all means consider this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central, comfortable and peaceful hotel”
Reviews.Author: kbergaust
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within walking distance of both the old East and old West, for instance Martin Gropius Bau and Unter den Linden. It is close to Gendarmenmarkt, a beautiful square with churches and a museum and several restaurants. The rooms were spacious and comfortable and were ideal also for spending some working time (we were a team of three attending a conference) The breakfast was very good, with esthetic qualities as well. I will certainly also recommend it for a holiday

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Puffin77
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have had an excellent week in this hotel. The location in the historic centre of the city (formerly East Berlin) is perfect, with many of the the key sights - Unter den Linden, the Brandenburg Gate, the Reichstag, Museum Island with its 5 museums - within 15 minutes walk. So are numerous restaurants and the shops of the Friedrichstrasse. The U-Bahn station Mitte is across the road, so more distant destinations such as Potsdam and Charlottenburg are easily reached. As for the hotel itself, it is nothing fancy, but everything it does is of the highest quality. In short, there is no downside to it at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Damian35
Reviews.Content: I have been staying in this hotel for business and have found the staff, rooms and service excellant. I have stayed in many Berlin hotels and would highly recommend Gendarm for business and personal travel. The only small down side is some noise from the street facing rooms, so try and book the courtyard rooms....although the view from the upper floors looking over the beautiful Cathedrals is great at night.

Reviews.Title: “My standard hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: VHei
Reviews.Content: I come to this hotel for more than 10 years now. Owners have changed; rooms have (fortunately) been renovated and the number of rooms has (unfortunately) been increased. I like the location: For me Gendarmenmarkt is one of the best spots in Berlin (the Hilton is right across the street) - be it for the Christmas market in winter or a drink at Newton´s Bar in summer. The hotel is by no means spectacular but ideal if you are looking for solid 4star service without any frills (no pool etc.). Breakfast is rich and tasty but there are also alternatives in the nearest distance: Try the French dejeuner in the basement of Galleries Lafayette next door (huitres ou croissant...)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in superb location.”
Reviews.Author: alpenbewohner
Reviews.Content: The location of this place is superb. Gendarmenmarkt itself is a beautiful place and all the sights in Mitte are easily accessible on foot. I had a ‘Komfort’ room which is slightly more expensive than their basic rooms but I thought very good value for money. It was spacious, modern, and clean. The only downside was I was given the room for handicapped people what meant the door would open automatically after unlocking it, and close automatically. Once this system failed working and the door did not close behind me any more. This was fixed in a reasonable amount of time, however it’s awkward to have a door you can’t close even for an hour. Wireless internet is available, but didn’t work on my mobile phone. Breakfast was good but fairly standard in terms of selection and quality, the breakfast room however is superbly decorated. Staff was extremely friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location, quality, wonderful service, good value...”
Reviews.Author: CintiKidCincinnati
Reviews.Content: The service at the front desk and at the fabulous breakfast is friendly and impeccable. Location is superb for walking around Berlin or for taking the U Bahn and S Bahn (U Bahn a few steps away). quiet. the rooms are minimalist, but very comfortable. We think the 10 extra euro per night for "Confort Room" was worth it. Vaue for price is excellent. Free internet terminal in foyer was appreciated. Many wonderful restaurants nearby (and faboulous chocolate store next door - a small sample in the room appears every afternoon! All in all highly recommended if you stay in Mitte.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Quality and Charm”
Reviews.Author: shooshy61
Reviews.Content: We chose this boutique hotel based on it's location and on the basis that it had a 2 bedroom suite which suited us as we were travelling with our daughter. We found a charming, small hotel in one of the most upmarket and convenient positions in Berlin. Walk out the door and there are wonderful choices of cafes, restaurants and bars. Lots of shopping options nearby, including Galeries Lafayette which was a mere 5 minute walk away. We also found that we could walk to many of the sights including the Reichstag, Checkpoint Charlie, Brandenburg Gate and The Jewish museum from the hotel. There is a U Bahn station almost directly in front of the hotel for further trips. Our suite(the Gendarmensuite) was comfortable, spacious, nicely decorated in pinks, purples and greys and very clean. Breakfast was served in a small but charming room and offered everything one could wish for including eggs cooked to order. My only small complaint was that the girl manning the front desk on our first two evenings was unable to assist us when we were unable to work out how to adjust the heating in our room. She was pleasant but did not have even a rudimentary knowledge of how the heating system worked...we finally figured it out ourselves after 2 days. Otherwise we really enjoyed our stay at The Gendarm Nouveau and it is an excellent choice in an area where there are several luxury hotels (The Regent, Westin Grand) but at very competitive rates.

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel, excellent location, good quality.”
Reviews.Author: Maaike-Fred
Reviews.Content: A charming hotel, every floor just 5 rooms. Ours was at the backside of the hotel. very quiet. No noise at all. The room has everything you want from a ****hotel. Modern but in warm colors decorated with romantic details . Very efficiently furnished with details like: automatic light in the closet and enough hangers for your clothes. a bathroom with enough space and very very clean. And the location is excellent.. a 10 minutes walk from most of the historical sites. A half an hour to the Spree, the museuminsel. Many good restaurants in the nabourhood. U bahn Stadmitte next to the hotel. 4 stops to Kurfustendamm or Alexanderplatz. Breakfast is also great and with an eye for detail. staff very friendly. So when in Berlin we will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No mistakes ... great value ... nice people”
Reviews.Author: Frank_and_Barbara
Reviews.Content: First time we picked this Hotel in Berlin, because of location and we want a small and new place this time. We got a nice, very clean and brand new room. Very friendly people at the reception desk and also during breakfast next morning. Furniture, shower and bed excellent. You park your car in the front of a hotel (you get a parking voucher), or in a parking deck cross the street. Location is on of the best. Breakfast (Saturdays until 12) very persona;. You must try the omelette's. The value for your money perfect! Next time we will know our Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, Clean, Cozy”
Reviews.Author: rmcolin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Gendarm in late March, 2010. We found it cozy, well located, and very clean. The staff was friendly, although not always present at the front desk, what wasn't a problem. Free Internet works fine. It has a nice breakfast (at a reasonable cost). The hotel is located two blocks from the metro, shops, nice restaurants, drugstores, and Checkpoint Charlie. We recommend it and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - a shame that I could only stay one night”
Reviews.Author: HKristensen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while participating in a conference in Berlin. The hotel has a great location - in East Berlin next to the Gendarmenmarkt. Very nice rooms (including balcony) with reliable wi-fi. Only con was that there was no gym - but Tierpark is close enough to run in.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy Central Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JayIss
Reviews.Content: Definitely a surprising find. Given the central location and the reasonable price, we had expecting something rather simple and basic. But we found a clean, modern place, with up-to-date facilities, clean rooms, a friendly staff, and a great breakfast. The hotel is right at the Gendarmenmarkt, three blocks from Unter den Linden and about four from Checkpoint Charlie, so in easy walking distance to the Brandenburger Tor and to the museums the other way. Some very good restaurants just along the Charlottenstraße and along Under den Linden. Our room was very well appointed, with an excellent, clean bathroom and a large, comfortable bed. Fresh mints were provided in the evening. Free WiFi in the rooms (worked fine on one computer although another of our computers couldn't associate with the access point).

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: RGLLondon
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is in a great location, within walking distance of most of the main sights, with a metro station just round the corner. Our room was large and comfortable, although the carpet had seen better days, and the breakfast was more than we could ask for. There are good restaurants for dinner quite close. The staff were as helpful as they could be given that they do not all speak English, a few words of German really helps. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: CanuckGirl2007
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Berlin for a 3 day stay and could not have been more pleased with this accommodation! I had a room facing the street (but it wasn't noisy at all - even with the windows open at night). I had a queen sized bed (super comfy and clean) and a spotless bathroom. There was a safe, mini bar, tv and writing desk and still enough room to walk around and not feel claustrophic (as is the case in other budget rooms found in cosmopolitan cities). Best news... this hotel is a real bargain, considering the location (within walking distance to major shopping streets -- Unter der Linden, Friederichstrasse & the Galleria -- also within walking distance to historic sites -- Reichstag, Brandenberger Tor, Checkpoint Charlie -- major museums like Pergamon at Museum Island -- and of course the underground subway is at every corner if you want to travel further. The breakfast was ample - with hot and cold choices and everything was fresh. The staff were tremendously helpful (despite not knowing hardly a word of English). Note: there is no evening reception. The doors are locked at 8pm and your hotel room key unlocks the front door, so it's self service from 8pm-6am, which didn't bother me in the slightest. As a single woman travelling alone, I found the area to be incredibly safe... even walking home alone late after midnight. The streets were still bustling with activity -- kind of like New York's fifth avenue -- and there are restaurants with outdoor cafes down every street within a stone's throw from hotel. I would definitely stay here again and recommend this to anyone! It's definitely worth the money... and I really cannot believe anyone would have a bad experience here. Everyone was so cheery... and you cannot get a more convenient locale. It's only a five minute cab ride to the main Train stn. My only worry is that too many people will discover this well kept secret in the center of Berlin and it'll be difficult to get reservations in the future! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: OlZ
Reviews.Content: Great location, walking distance from Unter d. Linden. seconds from Friedrichstr. Very nice-sized rooms. Great Breakfast. Very nice and helpful staff (though their English a bit poor). Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “LITTLE GEM”
Reviews.Author: LynB2
Reviews.Content: What a little gem! We found this hotel by surfing the net and would certainly recommend it. Really central, with the underground just round the corner in Gendarmenmarkt, a beautiful square with two churches and a concert hall. The bedrooms are clean and very comfortable, breakfast was good and the (all female) staff helpful and friendly. The area is surrounded by cafes and restaurants (try the Brasserie on the other side of the square), and the shops in the nearby arcade are to die for - try the food section of Galerie Lafayette! We will definitely stay here again on our next visit to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Back again!!”
Reviews.Author: andrew
Reviews.Content: Went back again to the Gendarm Hotel. Still a great place to stay. Standard of the hotel is as good as ever. Staff really nice and helpful. Breakfast excellent. Hotel so good we are going back again this year!!

Reviews.Title: “This is a lovely little hotel - - my favorite in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel quite by accident, looking for a good rate online. Previously in Berlin, I had stayed at the Hotel Unter den Linden, and found it to be satisfactory at best. It felt more like a pension than a hotel. So I lucked out and found Hotel Gendarm! It's a truly lovely hotel. My room really was more like a suite, with a separate sleeping area, and a small kitchen type arrangement. The views out the front of the Gendarmenmarkt are spectacular and it's close to everything, including the U-bahn, which is literally across the street. The windows are big and open easily. Everything was clean and in good working order. It's a small hotel, very quiet. They lock the door at night and you must use your key to get in the front door, but then again a lot of the smaller hotels in Europe are like that. The room service was wonderful and this was a very comfortable and nice hotel. I will definitely stay here again. I heard no noises at night, the bathroom was decent size. I didn't try the breakfast because I was feeling afraid to use my not-very-good German. Really nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: hawa
Reviews.Content: a lovely hotel in a beautiful square a few blocks from the unter der linden. the room was attractively furnished and the breakfasts were fantastic. close to most of the sights of berlin and many excellent restaurants. a u-bahn stop is across the street and it is a few stops to the zoo bahnhof. i would definitely stay here again.
